message.content: This question requires an understanding of the definition of "defunct" and the concept of a body of water losing all of its water. If a body of water loses all of its water, it is no longer functioning or operating as a body of water and can be considered defunct. Option (A) is incorrect because a body of water cannot be considered thriving if it has lost all of its water. Option (C) is incorrect because a body of water that has lost all of its water would not be flowing. Option (D) is incorrect because a body of water that has lost all of its water would not be growing.

To answer this question, we need to understand the meaning of the given words and how they relate to the concept of a body of water. Option (A) "thriving" means to be growing or flourishing, which is opposite to the scenario of losing all water. Option (C) "flowing" describes the movement of water, but if the body of water loses all water, there would be no flow. Option (D) "growing" implies an increase in size or quantity, which is not possible if all the water is lost.

The correct answer is (B) "defunct." This word means no longer functioning or operating, which accurately describes a body of water that has lost all its water.
